Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months

common_issues.title: Pieces OS users experiencing various bugs and errors
common_issues.description: Users are reporting issues with generating shareable links, cancelling LLM downloads, and experiencing slow performance with Long Term Memory. These issues persist across different Pieces OS versions and software components. Troubleshooting steps vary depending on the specific problem.

related_issues.title: Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months
related_issues.text:
Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months
### Software

Desktop Application, Web Extension, VS Code, Sharing Web App

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.12

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I've been unable to generate shareable personal links and utilize the web sharing app since before June '24. I've created an issue about this twice before, and the last time was just completely disregarded and it was closed out.

Here is the screenshot from within my Pieces Desktop when trying to generate a personal link, as well as generate a GitHub Gist:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0966a1a9-3076-4d9b-9006-88a14673cc9f)
Error generating summary: 400 Project `640481513740` is not allowed to use Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro`

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
Error generating summary: 400 Project `640481513740` is not allowed to use Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro`

recommendations: **Investigate Pieces OS Issues:** Prioritize addressing the bugs and errors reported by Pieces OS users, particularly those related to shareable links, LLM downloads, and slow Long Term Memory performance.
**Improve Share Link Functionality:** Focus on resolving the issue with generating personal shareable links, as it has persisted for over 6 months and significantly impacts user experience.

**Enhance LTM Performance:** Address the ongoing problem of Long Term Memory slowing down PCs, even after the LTM-2 update. Investigate CPU usage spikes and optimize performance for smoother user experience.

**Gather More Data on LLM Download Cancellation:** While a bug report exists for LLM download cancellation, its low activity level suggests limited information. Encourage users experiencing this issue to provide more details for effective troubleshooting.
**Review Triaged Ticket Status:** With a significant number of tickets categorized as 'status:triaged,' ensure timely review and appropriate action to prevent backlog and delays in resolution.
